description: zz centers the cursor line on screen. zt moves it to the top. zb to the bottom. Keep your context visible.

setup.comment: Set TERM for proper color support in Neovim

steps.say: Sometimes the cursor drifts to the edge of the screen. Z commands fix that.

steps.comment: --- Setup: move cursor to a line near the bottom ---

steps.say: Let me scroll down to the middle of the file.
Z Z centers the current line on screen.
Same line, but now it's in the middle. Much easier to read context above and below.
Z T moves the cursor line to the top.
Now we can see everything below the cursor. Great for reading a function top-down.
Z B moves it to the bottom.
Now we see everything above. Good for checking what came before.
And back to center. Z Z is the one you'll use most.
Z Z to center. Z T for top. Z B for bottom. Keep your cursor where you can see it.
